Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is ribbed and thickly encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394389) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394389)
